what: Reusable pipelines for the EXCEED study
title: Reusable pipelines for the EXCEED study
text: pipeline interface designed allow writing sharing reusable code minimizing duplication effort.

title: Reusable pipelines for the EXCEED study
text: introduction pipelines, please review following: vignette pipelines exceedapi package documentation. chapter 4 pipelines exceedapi-tutorial.

title: Reusable pipelines for the EXCEED study
text: default, exceedapi search reusable steps current environment main branch legenepi/exceed-pipelines repository github. configuration necessary ’re loading steps GitHub repo ’s recommended create GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT) repo scope, set using gitcreds::gitcreds_set(). information using GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT) R, follow guide Happy Git Pipelines can also loaded local directory github repo. example, want load steps main branch repo named skyfall account bond, create .yaml config file following: add bond/skyfall repo first place exceedapi look steps, followed default legenepi/exceed-pipelines can specify exact version load GitHub using standard GitHub syntax referencing branches tags. example, load specific version default repo, can create config file following: also need decide whether want per-project configuration file global one. per-project files, create exceedapi.yaml top-level directory project. global configuration files create .exceedapi.yaml home directory. cases, ’s recommended create per-project configuration files, kept separate directories. NOTE: name configuration file different ’s home directory must start dot .
code: pipeline:   search:   - bond/skyfall@main   - legenepi/exceed-pipelines@main:R pipeline:   search:   - legenepi/exceed-pipelines@v0.4.0:R

title: Reusable pipelines for the EXCEED study
text: Installing package required just want load pipeline steps GitHub directly. , however, install exceed.pipelines package keep mind ’d update whenever new functionality added. can install latest version exceed.pipelines package development server: previous versions package archived .
